area_name: Trail Side Wall aka Plain View Ridge

content.description: Start at the same holds as Lower Traverse, but follow the edge, reaching up and left finishing with a mantle.
The Direct starts low on the right side, and pulls through several contrived moves to gain the lip. The edge of the rock is off. Tracking makes this problem much more interesting.

climbs.name: Trail Side Direct Left AKA Left Plain View Arete

content.description: This climbs the arete/face over the bulge on the left side, finishing at the top of the Direct Right.
Work up the arete on the right side of the rock. Top it out on jugs. The upper arete to the top is optional. This is a fun little warmup or a good climb for beginners.
content.location: Far right side of the boulder.

content.description:
Plain View Traverse Low has good ol' Flagstaff ass dragging. Your body is literally inches off the ground for the crux, yet it's still pretty fun, and the movement is good!

flagstaffmountainbouldering…

- "begin on the far right at the arête ,and traverse left across the wall, using no holds above 5 feet. Drop down low after a few moves, and complete the traverse by using the low huecos instead of the incut fin/rail to reach the left arête," to the top from there.

climbs.name: Plain View Traverse aka Lower Traverse

content.description: This problem traverses the lower Trail Side Wall starting at the right side on the sloping rail/edge of the rock. Moving left follow the pockets and side pulls through the lower crux, finishing either by going up or continuing the traverse until you run out of rock.

This is a little lowball on the left side of the ridge, but for only being 6 feet tall, it is pretty fun and worth doing. The holds are good and start low and then move up to the crux of mantleing over the top.
content.location: This is on the left side of the Plain View Ridge, right of the Plain View Scramble and left of the main wall.

content.description: Adjust Your Sights is a very low SDS with your left hand on a small slopey rail and your right hand on a large sidepull jug. Heel hook beside your right hand, and make your way to and up the large fin generally up and left up much easier moves.
content.location: It is near the middle of the main section of Plain View Wall where there is a large up and left-trending fin.

pathTokens: Trail Side Wall aka Plain View Ridge
